page.title: 20PHYSICAL BACKGROUND
page.content: If you fly over Orkney, you will notice how{green and flat}it looks. Most of Orkney is quite low-lying and is used as grazing for cattle and sheep.This is because the land overlies{Old Red Sandstone}which breaks down to give a{fair soil. The island of{Hoy}is different,having {steep hills}and the highest {perpendicular cliff}in Britain as well as the famous{sea-stack}The Old Man of Hoy. Scattered over the land are many trout-filled{lochs}and small peat coloured{burns. The{climate}is influenced by the sea. The{rainfall}is about 93cms. a year.The{Winter temperature}is about average for Britain,being around 4.45 C.(40 F).The{Summer temperature is cool,however,being 12.25 C.(54 F).
